section.name: LoggerAppenderSyslog
section.p: LoggerAppenderSyslog logs events to the syslog.

subsection.name: Layout
subsection.p: This appender requires a layout. If no layout is specified in configuration, LoggerLayoutSimple will be used by default.

tr.td: A string which will identify your appender.
If set to true, all messages will be sent to the syslog using the priority specified in the priority parameter. Otherwise, the pririty will depend on the level of the event being logged. See below.
The syslog priority to use when overriding priority. This setting is required if overridePriority is set to true. See below for available priorities.
The syslog facility. Identifies the part of the system from which the event originated. See below for available facilities.
Syslog options. See below for available options.

subsection.name: Priorities
subsection.p: The priority is the syslog equivalent of the log4php level. Here's a list of priorities available in syslog and the equivalent log4php levels.
Messages with level FATAL will be logged using the syslog's ALERT priority; ERROR level message will use ERR priority, etc.
Note that there is no priority below DEBUG, therefore both TRACE and DEBUG level mesages will be logged using the DEBUG syslog priority.

subsection.name: Facilities
subsection.p: The facility parameter is used to specify what type of program is logging the message. This allows you to specify (in your machine's syslog configuration) how messages coming from different facilities will be handled.
Warning: USER is the only facility available on Windows operating systems.

subsection.name: Options
subsection.p: The following additional syslog options may be defined via the option parameter:

tr.td: If there is an error while sending data to the system logger, write directly to the system console
Open the connection to the logger immediately.
Delay opening the connection until the first message is logged (default).
Print log messages also to standard error.
Include the PID with each message.

subsection.p: Multiple options may be set by separating them with a pipe character. For example CONS|PID|NODELAY.
Warning: When setting multiple options in an INI configuration file, be sure to put the options string in quotes. Otherwise they will not be parsed correctly.

div.pre: <configuration xmlns="http://logging.apache.org/log4php/"> <appender name="default" class="LoggerAppenderSyslog"> <layout class="LoggerLayoutSimple" /> <param name="ident" value="log4php-test" /> <param name="facility" value="LOCAL0" /> <param name="option" value="NDELAY|PID" /> </appender> <root> <appender_ref ref="default" /> </root> </configuration>
